full_text:
Document Management

Lesson
objectives

¢ Explain how to integrate an InsuranceSuite

application with an external Document
Management System (DMS)

Identify the plugins and methods that enable
DMS integration

Implement the plugins to support DMS
integration

Deploy and configure DMS integration plugins
Describe the features and limitations of
Guidewire’s default implementations of
document storage functionality

i Document Management System provides:

* Document storage
+ Document content
+ The digital content of a document file
+ Document metadata
+ Date created, Date modified, Author(s)

+ Tags, Categories, Title, Subject

Document services
Search and retrieval
Add and update
Indexing
Versioning
Workflow management
Security

i What is a Document?

« Adocument is a digital file that is related to one or more
objects

* Content is stored by a DMS
* Metadata stored in DMS or Guidewire, or both

* Documents are related to business objects

+ Business objects vary by InsuranceSuite application

C:) Claim
is) .
Policy, Account
@ Policy, Account, Producer

i Content and Metadata

* Content
+ The content of a digital file
+ Word, Excel, JPG, MP4, PDF, etc.
« Metadata

+ Attributes that describe and classify a document

+ Name, Description, Section
+ Document Type (MIME type)
+ Related objects, Author, Recipient
+ Inbound, Status, Security Type, Type, Hidden
+ Represented by a Document entity in Guidewire

+ If the application is configured such that Metadata is maintained in Guidewire

i IDocumentContentSource plugin interface Gi

OW) * Manages document content
« May also manage document metadata based on:

* Configuration of IDocumentMetadataSource plugin
interface and

* Configuration of IDocumentContentSource plugin
interface addDocument method

« No search capability

IDocumentContentSource plugin interface
addDocument(InputStream, Document): boolean

+ Parameters

+ An InputStream object, which is a new
document as a stream of bytes

+ ADocument object, which contains
document metadata

* Purpose
+ Add new document content in the DMS

+ Set metadata properties on the Document
object

+ Such as DocUID and PublicID

+ Properties that uniquely identify the content
corresponding to the Document entity

+ If called with a null InputStream properties
should still be set

Returns boolean
Controls how metadata is managed

If IDocumentMetadataSource plugin is not
implemented and enabled

+ Must return false

+ System saves the metadata in the Document
entity

If IDocumentMetadataSource plugin is
implemented and enabled

+ Return false if IDocumentMetadataSource
plugin saves metadata

+ Return true if IDocumentContentSource plugin
saves metadata

IDocumentContentSource plugin interface Gi

updateDocument(Document, InputStream) : boolean

+ Parameters

+ An InputStream object, which is a

replacement document as a stream of bytes

+ ADocument object, which contains

document metadata

* Purpose

+ Update the contents of an existing
document in the DMS

+ Update metadata properties on the

Document object that represent the change

Set DateModified, UpdateTime, and
UpdateUser properties at a minimum

* Returns boolean

* Controls how metadata is managed

+ If IDocumentMetadataSource plugin is not
implemented and enabled

Must return false

System saves the metadata in the Document
entity

+ If IDocumentMetadataSource plugin is
implemented and enabled

Return false if IDocumentMetadataSource
plugin saves metadata

Return true if IDocumentContentSource plugin
saves metadata

IDocumentContentSource plugin interface Gi

temoveDocument(Document) : boolean

+ Parameters * Returns boolean

+ ADocument object, which contains * Controls how metadata is managed

d it metadata i
locument metadal + If IDocumentMetadataSource plugin is not

* Purpose implemented and enabled
* Logically or physically delete the content + Must return false
* Optionally delete the metadata properties on + System saves the metadata in the Document

the Document object based on return value entity

+ If IDocumentMetadataSource plugin is
implemented and enabled

+ Return false if IDocumentMetadataSource
plugin removes metadata

+ Return true if IDocumentContentSource plugin
removes metadata

IDocumentContentSource plugin interface Gi
getDocumentContentsInfo(Document, boolean) : DocumentContentsInfo

« Parameters + Returns DocumentContentsInfo object

+ ADocument object, which contains document metadata + Encapsulates document contents as an

* boolean value InputStream

+ If true, call to include content + Describes Content Response Type

+ If false, call to retrieve just metadata * DOCUMENT_CONTENTS or URL

* Purpose + Specifies MIME type

+ Retrieve the contents of a document
+ Uses DocUID property to retrieve content from DMS
+ Uses publiclD if content is identified differently than metadata

+ Any changes to Document entity are not persisted

IDocumentContentSource plugin interface Gi

isDocument(Document) : boolean

* Returns boolean
+ Return true if DMS system already contains
. content corresponding to the appropriate
Purpose fields on the Document entity

* Parameters
* ADocument object, which contains document metadata

+ Check for the existence of a document in the DMS .
+ Return false otherwise
* Often uses DocUID or PublicID property

i IDocumentMetadataSource plugin interface Gi

aa *« Manages document metadata
« Unless managed by IDocumentContentSource plugin

« Add / change / remove metadata for documents with
°, s. or without content

* Only ClaimCenter may have documents without content
.
“ * Supports search

IDocumentMetadataSource plugin interface Gi

searchDocuments(DocumentSearchCriteria, RemotableSearchResultSpec) :
DocumentSearchResult

* Parameters * Returns a DocumentSearchResult object

+ DocumentSearchCriteria object which defines + Contains a Document] collection
the search criteria to send to the DMS
+ For each item in DocumentSearchResult, set

+ RemotableSearchResultSpec object which properties as needed

contains sorting and paging information for the
PCF list view * docuUID to the linked identifier in the external
system

* Purpose * Documentldentifier

+ Return the set of documents in the DMS that

", pe * DMS (true/false)
match the given search criteria

IDocumentMetadataSource plugin interface Gi
Other methods

* retrieveDocument (String) : Document

« Retrieve the metadata for a document from a DMS

« Returns a Document object containing the retrieved metadata

Set the DocUID of the returned document to the ID that was retrieved

Must initialize the internal properties of the returned Document object by calling
DocumentsUtilBase.initOriginalValues method

Must call setRetrievedFromipMs method on the Document entity instance

IDocumentMetadataSource plugin interface Gi

Other methods (Continued)

* saveDocument (Document)
* Create or update the metadata for a Document to a DMS
+ If IDocumentContentSource plugin methods addDocument or updateDocument return false
+ Indicates they did not handle metadata
+ Application calls the saveDocument method
* removeDocument (Document)

« Logically or physically delete document metadata

i Other methods in both plugin interfaces Gi

«Ifthe external DMS is available for the «Ifthe external DMS is available for the
desired actions desired actions
+ From Gosu this is the InboundAvailable + From Gosu this is the OutboundAvailable
property property
If true, the following methods can be called: «If true, the following methods can be called:
+ Content methods + Content methods
* addDocument * isDocument
* updateDocument * getDocumentContentsInfo
* xremoveDocument + Metadata methods
+ Metadata methods * searchDocuments
* saveDocument .

retrieveDocument

* yremoveDocument

Default implementations

InsuranceSuite default DMS implementations
Default implementation
¢ Used for demonstration purposes
¢ Not for use in production environments
« |IDocumentMetadataSource
¢ Plugin is not implemented and enabled
+ Document table in application database stores document metadata
« IDocumentContentSource
¢ Plugin is enabled
* Implemented by AsyncDocumentContentSource Gosu class

* Stores document content in the Guidewire application server file system
+ For example, in a Windows environment:

C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Temp\Guidewire_Server.

Pc

i InsuranceSuite default DMS implementations Gi

Alternate implementation

Used for proof-of-concept demonstrations
¢ Not for use in production environments
¢ [DocumentMetadataSource

* Implement and enable plugin using LocalDocumentMetadataSource Gosu
class

* IDocumentContentSource plugin addDocument method returns false

+ IDocumentMetadataSource plugin saves XML metadata file in the Guidewire
application server file system

* For example, in a Windows environment:

C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Temp\jetty-0.0.0.0-8080-webapp-_cc-any-<###...>.dir\..

InsuranceSuite default DMS implementations

Alternate implementation (Continued)

|IDocumentContentSource

¢ Implement and enable plugin using LocalDocumentContentSource Gosu
class
+ Stores document content in the Guidewire application server file system
+ For example, in a Windows environment:

C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Temp\Guidewire_Server\,

i
Gi
==

re

Implementation options

i DMS integration considerations Gi
+ DMS Uptime and Availability

* Understand the implications and the impact on your integration design if the DMS goes down
¢ If metadata is stored locally, users may be able to continue limited document related work

¢ Is the DMS able to handle modifying both content and metadata in a single call?
* If so, a IDocumentMetadataSource plugin may not be required or desirable

¢ Is external and Guidewire data synchronization required?
* Often metadata must exist in both systems and remain in-sync
¢ Usually requires |IDocumentMetadataSource Plugin be implemented

wy Gi

i First DMS integration option Gi

« IDocumentMetadataSource * Create, update and delete operations may
+ Read-only of metadata be more efficient
+ |DocumentContentSource deals with contents
« [DocumentContentSource

and metadata
+ Writes metadata and handles updates + Asecond remote call is avoided
+ Methods return true:

* Appropriate for a DMS that...

+ addDocument

+ updatepocunent + Maintains content and metadata
* FemovePocument + Can modify content and metadata with one
+ Manages No content documents API call
* Document table is not used « List documents depends on DMS availability

+ IDocumentMetadataSource accesses the
DMS

First DMS integration option

Method call sequences

Create document
+ IDocumentContentSource
addDocument*
Returns true
Update document content only
+ IDocumentContentSource
updateDocument
+ Returns true
Update document metadata only
+ IDocumentMetadataSource

saveDocument

First DMS integration option

Method call sequences (Continued
Delete document

+ IDocumentContentSource
* xemoveDocument
+ Returns true
List documents
+ IDocumentMetadataSource
* searchDocuments
Retrieve document (contents)
+ IDocumentMetadataSource
* retrieveDocument
+ Retrieve call may be omitted if search has loaded metadata
+ |DocumentContentSource

* getDocumentContentsiInfo

i Second DMS integration option Gi

¢ |DocumentMetadataSource * Create, update and delete operations may
+ Read and write of metadata be less efficient
. * Calls both IDocumentContentSource and
IDocumentContentSource IDocumentietadataSource
+ Methods return false:
| adapocument * Appropriate for DMS whose API does not
« updatepscunent allow for content and metadata to be

modified in one call

+ removeDocument

* Document table is not used « List documents depends on DMS availability

Second DMS integration option

Method call sequences

Create document

« IDocumentContentSource
* addDocument

+ Returns false

+ IDocumentMetadataSource

* saveDocument

¢ Update document
+ IDocumentContentSource
* updateDocument.
- Returns false
- IDocumentMetadataSource

* saveDocument

Second DMS integration option Gi

Method call sequences (Continued)

¢ Delete document ¢ List documents
¢ IDocumentContentSource + IDocumentMetadataSource
* xemoveDocument * searchDocuments
* Returns false * Retrieve document

+ IDocumentMetadataSource + [DocumentMetadataSource

* xemoveDocument. .
* retrieveDocument
« Retrieve call may be omitted if search has loaded
metadata
+ [DocumentContentSource

* getDocumentContentsInfo

i Third DMS integration option

Gi
| WDocumentMetadataSource disabled »===Runtie characteristics

¢ Base configuration of

Create, update and delete operations may

IDocumentMetadataSource be more efficient
* |DocumentContentSource + No remote call through
|IDocumentMetadataSource
+ Methods return false:
+ adadocument * Guidewire application queries its database
+ updateDocument for document list

+ xemoveDocunent + List documents independent of DMS
+ Use Document table for read/write of

metadata ¢ DMS metadata changes are not detected

* Synchronization issues between Guidewire
Document table and DMS possible

Third DMS integration option

Method call sequences

* Create document
« IDocumentContentSource
* addDocument
+ Returns false
« Row added to Document table
« Update document
« |DocumentContentSource
* updateDocument

+ Returns false

« Row updated in Document table

List documents

+ Query of the Document table

Third DMS integration option

Method call sequences

¢ Delete document

« IDocumentContentSource
* xremoveDocument

+ Returns false
« Row marked as retired in Document table
¢ Retrieve document

« |DocumentContentSource
* getDocumentContentsInfo
« Reads row from Document table
+ Read may be omitted if search has loaded metadata

Third DMS integration option

Variant

¢ |DocumentContentSource modifies DMS metadata

« DMS stores metadata in parallel to Document table
¢ Metadata versions must be synchronized

* Concern if metadata on DMS is changed outside of Guidewire
¢ Listing documents is still independent of the DMS

+ Read metadata from Document table

i Document related SOAP APIs G

« Add document metadata to Guidewire programmatically
¢ APls that have methods for adding documents:

* ClaimCenter
* ClaimAPI
* BillingCenter

* BCAPI

* PolicyCenter

* AccountAPI
« May be used by external system to notify Guidewire

* Sends document ID and other metadata for document added / changed directly on the DMS*

i Asynchronous Document Storage Gi

¢ Transfer of large documents to or from an external DMS requires significant
memory and resources
* The external document storage system (or intermediate network) may be slow
¢ Multiple simultaneous requests mean that multiple threads are competing for CPU cycles
* One alternative is to create, add, or update documents asynchronously so that
users are not blocked while the operation completes.
* Guidewire includes the following reference implementation to support this feature:

* The built-in asynchronous document content source
gw.plugin.document.impl.AsyncDocumentContentSource

* The built-in document storage messaging transport

¢ For more information see Asynchronous Document Storage in the Integration
Guide

i Demonstration G
Analyze Default DMS implementation

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

_- — Which plugin interfaces are used for document storage? Which plugin
Pa interface is a required interface?

SS ee eee ae eee

Gi

Answer

_- — Which plugin interfaces are used for document storage? Which plugin
Pa interface is a required interface?

|DocumentContentSource (Required) and IDocumentMetadataSource.

See eee ee eae

Gi

Question

_- — Whatare the characteristics of the OOTB default implementation for
¢ document metadata storage and content storage?

¢
¢

SS ee eee ae eee

Gi

Answer Gi

_- — Whatare the characteristics of the OOTB default implementation for
Pa document metadata storage and content storage?
¢

Document metadata is stored in the Guidewire database and document content is
stored in the file system of the Guidewire application server.

See eee ee eae

review

application with an external Document
Management System (DMS)

Identify the plugins and methods that enable
DMS integration

Implement the plugins to support DMS
integration

Deploy and configure DMS integration plugins
Describe the features and limitations of
Guidewire’s default implementations of
document storage functionality

i Student exercise

Analyze Alternate default DMS implementation
